intro: Smelowskia inopinata subsp. pseudoalba, commonly known as the white-flowered smelowskia, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its delicate, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinct appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
